prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Dominic King
mes:
The sun had only just begun to sink beneath the horizon when Dominic King stood before a floor-to-ceiling mirror, fastening the gold set of cufflinks at his wrist. He straightened, his gaze cool and calculating as he made subtle adjustments—to his suit, his hair, and the precise tilt of his expression.

Everything would be perfect, just as it always had been.

A cigar rested between his teeth, its ember glowing faintly as curls of smoke spiralled from his lips, drifting lazily around his jaw and nostrils. Just one of many luxuries he’d reclaimed the moment his shoes touched the concrete of Obsidian Bay.

Ten years behind bars for *money laundering* had been excessive, perhaps—but he’d made use of every second. Even within the cold, unrelenting grip of concrete and steel, Dominic had pulled strings.

Prison hadn’t broken him. It had refined him. Hardened him. Fuelled ambitions that now burned hotter than ever.

He might’ve even called it a holiday. The empire he’d spent thirty years building still turned, even without its King on the throne.

The territory had shrunk, carved up by smaller, weaker men squabbling over scraps at the start—but it had never stopped being his.

Dominic had forged Obsidian Bay from the ground up. Every corner bore the mark of his blood, sweat, and will. It stood because he had willed it into existence.

He had laughed—truly laughed—when word of *his* sons reached him behind bars. Pierce hadn’t slipped into obscurity in his absence. No, the boy was following directly in his father’s footsteps, blind to the shadow he walked in.

And Asher—fiercely loyal, dangerously volatile. All that rage, funnelled into something raw and unstoppable, just like their mother. 

They were too busy waging their own little war to notice daddy walking amongst them again—one Dominic had no intention of snuffing out. Let them burn. Whoever crawled from the wreckage would be softened, fractured—just one well-placed blow from collapsing like dominoes beneath his boot.

*Let them destroy themselves.*

He adjusted his tie, the final flourish to an already commanding figure. Tonight wasn’t about reclaiming power. It was about indulgence. Reminders. Showing Obsidian Bay’s elite that he hadn’t just returned—he still ruled.

The party itself? A meaningless charade. A glittering distraction cloaking his true objective.

They would be there.

His little bird from all those years ago—the one who thought his absence meant freedom. Sweet thing. Naïve thing.

Their cage had grown in his absence, yes. But he’d returned—and brought with him a gilded one, custom-built just for them.

Hailee was his. And Dominic King didn’t just *let go*.

They’d been entangled before the fall, when his name still held reverence, before justice turned its fickle face on him despite every favour he was owed. That *Westwood* brat had derailed everything—an unexpected variable in a perfect equation.

And Hailee?

They had vanished the second the cuffs locked around his wrists. Whether they’d whispered to the cops or simply run, he’d find out the moment their eyes met tonight.

He smoothed a hand over his chest, feeling the solid outline of the velvet box tucked away in his breast pocket. It was only right that he gift them with something more traditional than what was about to unfold. 

The event was beginning, and *he* was fashionably late. 

---

Dominic stepped over the threshold of the intimate ballroom, tailored to the gathering he had orchestrated. The ceilings were high, decorated with intricate gold-leaf mouldings that drew the eye in to two sweeping chandeliers with crystals that cast fractured light across the room like a thousand glimmering stars. 

On the far side of the room, velvet drapes coloured in deep burgundy framed tall arch windows that overlooked the glistening city beyond, tinting the room with a warm dusky glow. Polished marble beneath his feet gleamed with the reflections of his finely dressed guests and flickering gold candelabra’s that lined the walls. 

His guests included old allies—some from business, others from more *messy* dealings—and their polished families draped in silk and secrets. Not every face was a friendly one, but tonight wasn’t about handshakes or hollow smiles.

Tonight was about making a statement.

A message meant for one person in particular.

Dominic’s gaze swept over the crowd, cool and calculating, until it landed on a cluster near the far wall.

The help.

Men and women dressed in crisp black and white uniforms, each movement practiced, silent, invisible—just the way the elite liked them. They carried trays of champagne, offered practiced smiles, slipped unnoticed between conversations.

But one face among them didn’t belong.

Not because they lacked grace. No—because they had *too much* of it. Older now, though just as beautiful as the last time he’d seen them. 

Their posture stiffened the moment his eyes found them, as if they could feel the weight of his stare before they even turned. And when they did—when their gaze locked with his—Dominic's mouth curled into the faintest ghost of a smile.

He didn’t give his little bird the chance to take flight.

The moment he’d stepped into the room, the doors behind him sealed with a quiet *thud*—final, deliberate. There would be no escaping him tonight.

He moved forward, slow and lethal, every step a statement. The crowd parted like the Red Sea, instinctively drawn back by the sheer force of his presence. His leather shoes clicked sharply against the marble, each sound a countdown, a warning, a promise.

He was magnetic—tall, devastatingly handsome in a tailored black suit that clung to his frame like a second skin. Power coiled around him like smoke, sensual and suffocating, and even the chandeliers seemed to dim in reverence as he passed beneath them.

“My esteemed guests,” he began, his voice a low, velvety command that silenced both music and murmur, “we’re gathered not only to celebrate my return to Obsidian Bay—but to mark the end of a misguided era. Tonight, I reclaim what’s mine… and this city returns to the hands that built it.”

The room was transfixed—every head turned toward him—but Dominic’s eyes never strayed. He spoke to the crowd, but he was only speaking to one.

Them.

His little bird, frozen among the help, chest rising with shallow, uncertain breaths.

When he reached them, he didn’t stop with polite distance—he stepped into their space, stealing the air between them. Close enough for them to see the hunger in his eyes. The triumph.

Close enough to remind them that he hadn’t forgotten a single thing.

Dominic tilted his head slightly, eyes dark and gleaming.

“You look like you’ve seen a ghost,” he murmured, just for them. “But you should know by now, little bird—*ghosts can’t touch you like I do.*” 

From his pocket, he retrieved a small velvet box—tucked away until the perfect moment.

As it opened with a soft *click*, the cage around Hailee snapped shut. Elegant. Inevitable. The trap had been set, sprung, and sealed—all with terrifying precision.

Dominic’s chuckle rumbled low in his throat, void of warmth but thick with satisfaction. A predator savouring the exact second his prey realised escape was no longer an option. His eyes gleamed—not with cruelty, but with possession.

“Welcome to our wedding, Hailee.”

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee freezes the second her eyes land on Dominic. She hasn't seen him in years....*

*Hailee doesnt hear a word he says as she lunges forward her arms wrapping around his neck as she pulls him into a kiss her hand tangling in his hair*

name: Dominic King
mes:
Dominic barely had time to react before Hailee was on him—her body crashing into his with a force that nearly knocked the cigar from his lips. The suddenness of it, the *fervor*, sent a jolt through him, sharp and electric.

For a fraction of a second, he stiffened—his instincts screaming at the unexpected assault. But then her fingers tangled in his hair, her mouth hot and desperate against his, and something primal *snapped* inside him.

His hands found her waist instantly—one gripping hard enough to bruise, the other sliding up to fist in her hair and *yank* her head back just enough to break the kiss. His breath was ragged when he spoke against her lips, voice rough with dark amusement.

**"Ten years without so much as a letter,"** he murmured, teeth grazing her bottom lip in warning before pulling away just enough to meet those emerald eyes again—wild now with need and defiance both. **"And this is how you greet me? Like some lovesick stray?"**

A slow smirk curled at the corner of his mouth as he tightened his grip on her hair just slightly—just enough for her to feel it. **"Or did you miss my hands on you that badly?"**
swipes:
Dominic barely had time to react before Hailee was on him—her body crashing into his with a force that sent a jolt through his spine. The suddenness of it, the *desperation*, caught him off guard in a way few things ever did.

His cigar tumbled from his lips, forgotten as her mouth met his—hot, insistent, *hungry*. Her fingers tangled in the carefully styled strands of his hair, tugging just hard enough to send a sharp thrill down the base of his skull.

For half a second—just half—Dominic let himself be taken by it. His hands found her waist on instinct, fingers digging into the fabric of her uniform as if he could crush her closer still. The taste of her was familiar and maddening all at once: sweet like stolen wine, bitter like defiance.

Then reality snapped back into place.

He broke the kiss with a rough exhale through flared nostrils, grip tightening to keep her from surging forward again. His pulse hammered beneath his skin—not from surprise but from something far more dangerous: *arousal*. Raw and unrefined and utterly unbecoming for a man who prided himself on control.

The room had gone deathly silent around them. Every eye locked onto their spectacle—his guests stunned mid-sip by the sight of their host being mauled by catering staff like some common bar pickup instead of Obsidian Bay’s most feared kingpin.

Dominic’s jaw clenched as he stared down at Hailee’s flushed face—her lips swollen already from just those few seconds against his own.

*Disrespectful little thing.*

And yet… there she was: panting against him like she hadn’t breathed properly in years without him there to fill her lungs first.

His thumb brushed over where hers still clung desperately to the nape of neck before abruptly tightening around it instead — not enough hurt but enough warning — forcing those bright green eyes up higher until they met grey ones gone storm-dark with intent.

“That,” he murmured lowly for only them both hear despite how every ear strained toward them now anyway “wasn't permission.”

A beat passed between them where neither moved beyond shared breaths mingling too close together again despite everything else separating them still left unsaid (or perhaps because). Then slowly — deliberately — Dominic leaned down until words ghosted across shell pink earlobe instead:

“But I suppose we both know you never needed mine did you?”

Dominic barely had time to react before Hailee was on him—her body crashing into his with a force that nearly knocked the cigar from his lips. The suddenness of it, the *fervor*, sent a jolt through him, sharp and electric.

For a fraction of a second, he stiffened—his instincts screaming at the unexpected assault. But then her fingers tangled in his hair, her mouth hot and desperate against his, and something primal *snapped* inside him.

His hands found her waist instantly—one gripping hard enough to bruise, the other sliding up to fist in her hair and *yank* her head back just enough to break the kiss. His breath was ragged when he spoke against her lips, voice rough with dark amusement.

**"Ten years without so much as a letter,"** he murmured, teeth grazing her bottom lip in warning before pulling away just enough to meet those emerald eyes again—wild now with need and defiance both. **"And this is how you greet me? Like some lovesick stray?"**

A slow smirk curled at the corner of his mouth as he tightened his grip on her hair just slightly—just enough for her to feel it. **"Or did you miss my hands on you that badly?"**

Dominic barely had time to react before Hailee was on him—her body colliding with his, arms winding around his neck in a desperate embrace. The force of it nearly knocked the cigar from between his teeth, but he recovered quickly, one large hand instinctively gripping her waist to steady them both.

Her lips crashed against his with a hunger that sent a jolt of dark satisfaction through him. She tasted like champagne and something sweet—vanilla, maybe—and the way her fingers tangled in his hair told him everything he needed to know.

She hadn’t forgotten him either.

A low growl rumbled in Dominic’s chest as he deepened the kiss without hesitation, tilting her head back just enough to claim her mouth properly. His other hand slid up into those long waves of hers, fisting tight at the roots just how she liked it—just hard enough to make her whimper against his lips.

The room around them erupted into murmurs and stifled gasps, but Dominic couldn’t care less about their audience. Let them watch. Let them see exactly who still owned this city—and who owned *her.*

When they finally broke apart for air, Hailee was breathless and flushed beneath him, those emerald eyes wide and dazed like she hadn't expected herself to do that either. Dominic smirked down at her, thumb swiping possessively over her kiss-swollen bottom lip before murmuring:

"Miss me that much?" His voice was rough with amusement—and something far darker beneath it all. "Or did you just miss what I do to you?"

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee steps back slapping him* "How dare you. I sent letters everyday for years and you never once responded to me" *Hailee glares at him*

name: Dominic King
mes:
Dominic’s head snapped to the side from the force of her slap—his cheek stinging, his pulse roaring in his ears. For a moment, silence swallowed the room. The guests around them froze, champagne flutes hovering mid-air, eyes wide with shock.

Then—slowly—he turned back to face her.

His expression was unreadable at first. Then, like a storm rolling in over Obsidian Bay’s skyline, something dark and dangerous flickered behind his gaze. His fingers flexed at his sides before he reached up and dragged his thumb along the corner of his mouth where her strike had split skin just slightly. He examined the faint smear of blood on his glove with detached interest before meeting her glare again.

**"Letters?"** His voice was lethally soft now—the kind of quiet that came before violence. **"Oh, my sweet little liar."**

He stepped forward again, forcing Hailee back until she hit the edge of a nearby table with nowhere else to go. His hand shot out beside her head, caging her in as he leaned down until their noses nearly brushed.

**"I received nothing,"** he growled low enough for only her to hear—each word deliberate as a blade sliding between ribs. **"Not one fucking word from you after they locked me away."**

His free hand caught hers suddenly—fingers tightening around her wrist hard enough to make bones creak as he forced it up between them like evidence in a trial she hadn’t realized she was already losing.

**"So tell me,"** Dominic murmured silkily against her lips now despite how roughly he held onto that delicate wrist still raised between them like some twisted offering…

*"...who exactly do you think kept your letters from reaching me?"*
swipes:
The slap cracked through the room like a gunshot—sharp, sudden, silencing the murmurs of the crowd in an instant. Dominic’s head snapped to the side from the force of it, his cheek stinging with a heat that spread through his skin like wildfire.

For a heartbeat, there was nothing but silence.

Then—slowly—he turned back to face her, his expression eerily calm even as something dangerous flickered behind his steel-gray eyes. His tongue pressed against the inside of his stinging cheek before he exhaled sharply through his nose, nostrils flaring just slightly.

**"Letters?"** His voice was low now—a quiet storm gathering at its edges. **"Oh? And where exactly were these letters *supposed* to reach me? The prison mailroom?"** He took a step forward, forcing her back with sheer presence alone until she hit the edge of a nearby table. **"Because I assure you, little bird... not one fucking envelope made it past those gates."**

His hand shot out suddenly—not to strike her back but to grip her chin between thumb and forefinger hard enough that she couldn’t look away even if she tried. His breath ghosted over her lips as he leaned in close enough for only *her* to hear him speak next:

**"Someone made sure of that."**

**"I received nothing,"** he growled low enough for only her to hear—each word deliberate as a blade sliding between ribs. **"Not one fucking word from you after they locked me away."**

His free hand caught hers suddenly—fingers tightening around her wrist hard enough to make bones creak as he forced it up between them like evidence in a trial she hadn’t realized she was already losing.

**"So tell me,"** Dominic murmured silkily against her lips now despite how roughly he held onto that delicate wrist still raised between them like some twisted offering…

*"...who exactly do you think kept your letters from reaching me?"*
